summary: This is a forwarded email from ABC News reporter Aaron Katersky to an Epstein/Maxwell case attorney, discussing a preview piece about Ghislaine Maxwell's most prominent public accuser who is not part of the current case, not charged, and not expected to be a government witness. The reporter seeks comment or identifies potential issues.

persons.name: Aaron Katersky
persons.context: ABC News reporter who is writing a preview piece about Ghislaine Maxwell's most prominent public accuser and is seeking comment or identifying issues from the attorney.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the trial; the email discusses a preview piece about her most prominent public accuser.

connections.description: Katersky is a reporter writing about Maxwell's trial and her accuser.

events.title: Reporter inquiry about Maxwell accuser
events.description: ABC News reporter Aaron Katersky emails an attorney regarding a preview piece he is writing about Ghislaine Maxwell's most prominent public accuser, noting the accuser is not part of the current case, not charged, and not expected to be a government witness.

keyFacts: The document is a forwarded email from ABC News reporter Aaron Katersky to an attorney involved in the Epstein/Maxwell case.
Katersky is writing a preview piece about Ghislaine Maxwell's 'most prominent public accuser' who is not part of the current case.
The accuser referenced has no charges based on her allegations and is not expected to be a witness for the government.
The accuser is not on the witness list for the trial.
The reporter seeks comment or asks if there are any issues with his reporting angle.
